message: Yeah, I always feel like I'll accidentally buy something :(
I'm curious too...
i was managing some domains there earlier today, even after you buy it seems like every button has a price tag on it

Is it just me or do other people hate the GoDaddy check out process as well?

I feel like I’m buying from a sleazy infomercial with the amount of crap they try and push on you as you check out.
what are some better sites to buy domains from?

i'm not sure if there are any better ones, looking at the list of registrars at verisign is not very encouraging http://www.verisigninc.com/en_US/products-and-services/domain-name-services/find-registrar/index.xhtml
well, I did business with godaddy too.. but I dont know another choice atm
domain registration must be like the check into cash of the internet
I quit using GoDaddy a while ago and now use Namecheap.  Feels a lot better not to be supporting a misogynistic company with such bad taste

Yeah GoDaddy has really become a disappointment for me.  I've moved all my domains to Hover.com after I heard about them on TWiT.  They are owned by TuCows so they've been around for a LONG time.  I actually became an affiliate so if you would like 10% off at checkout use code KRWSOLUTIONS.  http://www.hover.com/krwsolutions
I have worked on getting my domains switched over to namecheap as well. A much better company to work with. Don't need to stay with GoDaddy
except for my .com.au`s, i'm on hover just to support twit,...
Namecheap is definitely the way to go. I just recently switched all my domains over to them and I couldn't be happier.
@dustdaughter Name,101domain.com, netim , my.such.as are my choice
I never use Godaddy. But I use name,netim and 101domain

I've been steadily migrating from GoDaddy to BlueHost. GD has the worst website design (from both a UX and art direction POV) in history, which is indeed ironic. BlueHost is clearly for and by nerds, because it's not the most usable thing either. But they're great folks and the customer support is always reliable and attentive. I recommend them. They don't pay me.

I recently contacted GoDaddy customer support to have an odd charge removed. I commented that their checkout process seemed designed to be overly complex with the goal of tricking me into buying something I didn't want. The rep actually became indignant, argued with me, and wouldn't acknowledge my concerns. Remarkable.
I sent a complaint email. Ignored.

GoDaddy has such a bad user experience. I always lost myself in dozens of strangely named links and menus even for simple tasks. Additionally the page always feels like walking into the lad's mag section in the local supermarket, which is not what I want from my domain hoster. I switched to http://iwantmyname.com some time ago and it's really great so far.
@GoCatGo That's awful. Their reps must not get any customer service training.
Thanks everyone for the alternatives you suggested.

Like MrTazz, I moved my domains to http://twit.hover.com. First, they are a TWiT sponsor, so that's a plus in my book and I'm not really into the way GoDaddy goes about doing their business. I think they have good customer support, but the sales techniques are so aggressive it was a turn off.
Their user interface is the worst I ever saw. I just moved a friend domains out of this mess.
@GoCatGo Some companies don't concentrate how the staff are dealing with the customers. Most popular web-Hosts & domain registrars too have such in-experienced staff.
@rmiller I think Hover.com don't offer many ccTLDs and gTLDs. I love using ccTLDs than the common .com/ .co / net
@Asshu Our business only uses .com, so for me it was okay.
what's worse is companies trying to imitate them
I tried to use hover.com but I couldn't register.  I since started moving my domains to https://www.gandi.net
I used hostgator for a few years for a oscommerce shopping site - no big complaints, 99.9% uptime...

I used to use GoDaddy for managing my domains and those of my clients.  Their process and values finally slid so far into the toilet I couldn't stomach doing business with them anymore.  I have moved everything away now.  I recommend either Hover (if you care about hand-holding customer service for a few extra dollars) or GKG.net for the more price conscious.  I hope that helps.
I prefer 123-reg, but hover looks good too. Cross selling is fine, and sometimes useful, but GoDaddy takes it to an extreme level.
@FCGreg actually hover is cheaper than godaddy if you need domain privacy...
